symbols.name: sap.m.FeedListItem
symbols.description: The control provides a set of properties for text, sender information, time stamp. Beginning with release 1.23 the new feature expand / collapse was introduced, which uses the property maxCharacters. Beginning with release 1.44, sap.m.FormattedText was introduced which allows html formatted text to be displayed

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Icon to be displayed as graphical element within the FeedListItem. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font. If no icon is provided, a default person-placeholder icon is displayed. Icon is only shown if showIcon = true.

properties.name: activeIcon
properties.description: Icon displayed when the list item is active.

properties.name: sender
properties.description: Sender of the chunk

properties.name: text
properties.description: The FeedListItem text. It supports html formatted tags as described in the documentation of sap.m.FormattedText

properties.name: info
properties.description: The Info text.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: This chunks timestamp

properties.name: senderActive
properties.description: If true, sender string is a link, which will fire 'senderPress' events. If false, sender is normal text.

properties.name: iconActive
properties.description: If true, icon is a link, which will fire 'iconPress' events. If false, icon is normal image

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description:
By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server.

If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: showIcon
properties.description: If set to "true" (default), icons will be displayed, if set to false icons are hidden

properties.name: convertLinksToAnchorTags
properties.description: Determines whether strings that appear to be links will be converted to HTML anchor tags, and what are the criteria for recognizing them.

properties.name: convertedLinksDefaultTarget
properties.description: Determines the target attribute of the generated HTML anchor tags. Note: Applicable only if ConvertLinksToAnchorTags property is used with a value other than sap.m.LinkConversion.None. Options are the standard values for the target attribute of the HTML anchor tag: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search.

properties.name: maxCharacters
properties.description: The expand and collapse feature is set by default and uses 300 characters on mobile devices and 500 characters on desktops as limits. Based on these values, the text of the FeedListItem is collapsed once text reaches these limits. In this case, only the specified number of characters is displayed. By clicking on the text link More, the entire text can be displayed. The text link Less collapses the text. The application is able to set the value to its needs.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexAlignContent
symbols.description: Available options for the layout of container lines along the cross axis of the flexbox layout. Note: This property has no effect in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: Line are packed toward the center of the line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Lines are packed toward the end of the line.

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: SpaceAround
properties.description: Lines are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end. Note: This value behaves like SpaceBetween in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: SpaceBetween
properties.description: Lines are evenly distributed in the line.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: Lines are packed toward the start of the line.

properties.name: Stretch
properties.description: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexAlignItems
symbols.description: Available options for the layout of all elements along the cross axis of the flexbox layout.

properties.name: Baseline
properties.description: If the flex item's inline axes are the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to "Start". Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment: all participating box items on the line are aligned such that their baselines align, and the item with the largest distance between its baseline and its cross-start margin edge is placed flush against the cross-start edge of the line.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: The flex item's margin boxes are centered in the cross axis within the line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: The cross-start margin edges of the flex items are placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: The cross-start margin edges of the flex items are placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

properties.name: Stretch
properties.description: Make the cross size of the item's margin boxes as close to the same size as the line as possible.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexAlignSelf
symbols.description: Available options for the layout of individual elements along the cross axis of the flexbox layout overriding the default alignment.

properties.name: Auto
properties.description: Takes up the value of alignItems from the parent FlexBox

properties.name: Baseline
properties.description: If the flex item's inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to "Start". Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment: all participating box items on the line are aligned such that their baselines align, and the item with the largest distance between its baseline and its cross-start margin edge is placed flush against the cross-start edge of the line.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: The flex item's margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: The cross-start margin edges of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: The cross-start margin edges of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

properties.name: Stretch
properties.description: Make the cross size of the item's margin box as close to the same size as the line as possible.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexBox
symbols.description:
The sap.m.FlexBox control builds the container for a flexible box layout.

Note: Be sure to check the renderType setting to avoid issues due to browser inconsistencies.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the sap.m.FlexBox. Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the sap.m.FlexBox. Note that when a percentage is given, for the width to work as expected, the width of the surrounding container must be defined.

properties.name: displayInline
properties.description: Determines whether the sap.m.FlexBox is in block or inline mode.

properties.name: direction
properties.description: Determines the direction of the layout of child elements.

properties.name: fitContainer
properties.description: Determines whether the sap.m.FlexBox will be sized to completely fill its container. If the sap.m.FlexBox is inserted into a Page, the property 'enableScrolling' of the Page needs to be set to 'false' for the FlexBox to fit the entire viewport.

properties.name: renderType
properties.description:
Determines whether the layout is rendered as a series of divs or as an unordered list (ul).

We recommend to use Bare in most cases to avoid layout issues due to browser inconsistencies.

properties.name: justifyContent
properties.description: Determines the layout behavior along the main axis.

properties.name: alignItems
properties.description: Determines the layout behavior of items along the cross-axis. "Baseline" is not supported in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: wrap
properties.description: Determines the wrapping behavior of the flex container. This property has no effect in older browsers, e.g. Android Native 4.3 and below.

properties.name: alignContent
properties.description: Determines the layout behavior of container lines when there's extra space along the cross-axis. This property has no effect in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Defines the background style of the sap.m.FlexBox.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexDirection
symbols.description: Available directions for flex layouts.

properties.name: Column
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the direction of the block axis (usually top to bottom).

properties.name: ColumnReverse
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the reverse direction of the block axis (usually bottom to top).

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: Row
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the direction of the inline axis (text direction).

properties.name: RowReverse
properties.description: Flex items are laid out along the reverse direction of the inline axis (against the text direction).

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexItemData
symbols.description: Holds layout data for a FlexBox / HBox / VBox.

properties.name: alignSelf
properties.description: Determines cross-axis alignment of individual element (not currently supported in Internet Explorer).

properties.name: order
properties.description: Determines the display order of flex items independent of their source code order.

properties.name: growFactor
properties.description: Determines the flexibility of the flex item when allocatable space is remaining.

properties.name: shrinkFactor
properties.description: The shrink factor determines how much the flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items in the flex container when negative free space is distributed.

properties.name: baseSize
properties.description: The base size is the initial main size of the item for the flex algorithm. If set to "auto", this will be the computed size of the item.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: The minimum height of the flex item.

properties.name: maxHeight
properties.description: The maximum height of the flex item.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: The minimum height of the flex item.

properties.name: maxWidth
properties.description: The maximum height of the flex item.

properties.name: styleClass
properties.description: The style class will be applied to the flex item and can be used for CSS selectors.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Defines the background style of the flex item.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexJustifyContent
symbols.description: Available options for the layout of elements along the main axis of the flexbox layout.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

properties.name: Inherit
properties.description: Inherits the value from its parent.

properties.name: SpaceAround
properties.description: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end. Note: This value behaves like SpaceBetween in Internet Explorer 10.

properties.name: SpaceBetween
properties.description: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexRendertype
symbols.description: Determines the type of HTML elements used for rendering controls.

properties.name: Bare
properties.description: The UI5 controls are not wrapped in an additional HTML element, the surrounding Flex Box is a DIV element.

properties.name: Div
properties.description: The UI5 controls are wrapped in DIV elements.

properties.name: List
properties.description: The UI5 controls are wrapped in LI elements, the surrounding Flex Box is an unordered list (UL).

symbols.name: sap.m.FlexWrap
symbols.description: Available options for the wrapping behavior of a flex container.

properties.name: NoWrap
properties.description: The flex container is single-line.

properties.name: Wrap
properties.description: The flex container is multi-line.

properties.name: WrapReverse
properties.description: The flex container is multi-line with the cross-axis start and end being swapped.

symbols.name: sap.m.FormattedText
symbols.description: The FormattedText control allows the usage of a limited set of tags for inline display of formatted text in HTML format.

properties.name: htmlText
properties.description:
Text in HTML format. The following tags are supported:
  • a
  • abbr
  • blockquote
  • br
  • cite

symbols.name: sap.m.FrameType
symbols.description: Enum for possible frame size types for sap.m.TileContent and sap.m.GenericTile control.

properties.name: Auto
properties.description: The Auto frame type that adjusts the size of the control to the content. Support for this type in sap.m.GenericTile is deprecated since 1.48.0.

properties.name: OneByOne
properties.description: The 1x1 frame type.

properties.name: TwoByOne
properties.description: The 2x1 frame type.

properties.name: TwoThirds
properties.description: The 2/3 frame type.

symbols.name: sap.m.GenericTile
symbols.description: Displays header, subheader, and a customizable main area in a tile format. Since 1.44, also an in-line format which contains only header and subheader is supported.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: The mode of the GenericTile.

properties.name: header
properties.description: The header of the tile.

properties.name: subheader
properties.description: The subheader of the tile.

properties.name: failedText
properties.description: The message that appears when the control is in the Failed state.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The size of the tile. If not set, then the default size is applied based on the device.

deprecated.text: The GenericTile control has now a fixed size, depending on the used media (desktop, tablet or phone).

properties.name: frameType
properties.description: The frame type: OneByOne or TwoByOne. Set to OneByOne as default if no property is defined or set to Auto by the app.

properties.name: backgroundImage
properties.description: The URI of the background image.

properties.name: headerImage
properties.description: The image to be displayed as a graphical element within the header. This can be an image or an icon from the icon font.

properties.name: state
properties.description: The load status.

properties.name: imageDescription
properties.description: Description of a header image that is used in the tooltip.

properties.name: scope
properties.description: Changes the visualization in order to enable additional actions with the Generic Tile.

properties.name: ariaLabel
properties.description: Additional description for aria-label. The aria-label is rendered before the standard aria-label.

aggregations.description: The content of the tile.

aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the title.

aggregations.description: The hidden aggregation for the message in the failed state.

events.name: press
events.description: The event is triggered when the user presses the tile.

scope.name: scope
scope.description: The current scope the GenericTile was in when the event occurred.

action.name: action
action.description: The action that was pressed on the tile. In the Actions scope, the available actions are Press and Remove. In Display scope, the parameter value is only Press.

domRef.name: domRef
domRef.description: The pressed DOM Element pointing to the GenericTile's DOM Element in Display scope. In Actions scope it points to the more icon, when the tile is pressed, or to the DOM Element of the remove button, when the remove button is pressed.

symbols.name: sap.m.GenericTileMode
symbols.description: Defines the mode of GenericTile.

properties.name: ContentMode
properties.description: Default mode (Two lines for the header and one line for the subtitle).

properties.name: HeaderMode
properties.description: Header mode (Four lines for the header and one line for the subtitle).

properties.name: LineMode
properties.description: Line mode (Implemented for both, cozy and compact densities. Generic Tile is displayed as in-line element, header and subheader are displayed in one line. In case the texts need more than one line, the representation depends on the used density. Cozy: The text will be truncated and the full text is shown in a tooltip as soon as the tile is hovered (desktop only). Compact: Header and subheader are rendered continuously spanning multiple lines, no tooltip is provided).

symbols.name: sap.m.GenericTileScope
symbols.description: Defines the scopes of GenericTile enabling the developer to implement different "flavors" of tiles.

properties.name: Actions
properties.description: Action scope (Possible footer and Error State information is overlaid, "Remove" and "More" icons are added to the tile).

properties.name: Display
properties.description: Default scope (The default scope of the tile, no action icons are rendered).

symbols.name: sap.m.GroupHeaderListItem
symbols.description: sap.m.GroupHeaderListItem is used to display the title of a group and act as separator between groups in sap.m.List and sap.m.Table. Note: The inherited properties unread, selected, counter and press event from sap.m.ListItemBase are not supported.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Defines the title of the group header.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Defines the count of items in the group, but it could also be an amount which represents the sum of all amounts in the group. Note: Will not be displayed if not set.

properties.name: upperCase
properties.description: Allows to uppercase the group title.

properties.name: titleTextDirection
properties.description: Defines the title text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

symbols.name: sap.m.GrowingList
symbols.description: sap.m.GrowingList control is the container for all list items and inherits from sap.m.List control. Everything like the selection, deletion, unread states and inset style are also maintained here. In addition the control provides a loading mechanism to request data from the model and append the list items to the list. The request is started manually by tapping on the trigger at the end of the list.

deprecated.text: Instead use "List" or "Table" control with setting "growing" property to "true"

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Number of items requested from the server. To activate this you should set growing property to "true"

properties.name: triggerText
properties.description: Text which is displayed on the trigger at the end of the list. The default is a translated text ("Load More Data") coming from the messagebundle properties. This property can be used only if growing property is set "true" and scrollToLoad property is set "false".

properties.name: scrollToLoad
properties.description: If you set this property to true then user needs to scroll end to trigger loading a new page. Default value is false which means user needs to scroll end and then click button to load new page. NOTE: This property can be set true, if growing property is set "true" and if you only have one instance of this control inside the scroll container(e.g Page).

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.HBox

The HBox control builds the container for a horizontal flexible box layout. HBox is a convenience control, as it is just a specialized FlexBox control.

symbols.name: sap.m.HeaderContainer
symbols.description: The container that provides a horizontal layout. It provides a horizontal scrolling on the mobile devices. On the desktop, it provides scroll left and scroll right buttons. This control supports keyboard navigation. You can use left and right arrow keys to navigate through the inner content. The Home key puts focus on the first control and the End key puts focus on the last control. Use Enter or Space key to choose the control.

properties.name: scrollStep
properties.description: Number of pixels to scroll when the user chooses Next or Previous buttons. Relevant only for desktop.

properties.name: scrollStepByItem
properties.description: Number of items to scroll when the user chose Next or Previous buttons. Relevant only for desktop. Have priority over 'ScrollStep'. Have to be positive number.

properties.name: scrollTime
properties.description: Scroll animation time in milliseconds.

properties.name: showOverflowItem
properties.description: Indicates whether the incomplete item on the edge of visible area is displayed or hidden.

properties.name: showDividers
properties.description: If set to true, it shows dividers between the different content controls.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: The orientation of the HeaderContainer. There are two orientation modes: horizontal and vertical. In horizontal mode the content controls are displayed next to each other, in vertical mode the content controls are displayed on top of each other.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description: Specifies the background color of the content. The visualization of the different options depends on the used theme.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the whole HeaderContainer. If not specified, it is rendered as '100%' in horizontal orientation and as 'auto' in vertical orientation.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the whole HeaderContainer. If not specified, it is rendered as 'auto' in horizontal orientation and as '100%' in vertical orientation.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content to add to HeaderContainer.

aggregations.description: Scroll container for smooth scrolling on different platforms.

aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to previous section.

aggregations.name: _nextButton
aggregations.description: Button that allows to scroll to next section.

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTabBar

properties.name: showSelection
properties.description: Defines whether the current selection should be visualized.

deprecated.text: Regarding to changes of this control this property is not needed anymore.

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Defines if the tabs are collapsible and expandable.

properties.name: expanded
properties.description: Indicates if the actual tab content is expanded or not.

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description:
Key of the selected tab item.

If the key has no corresponding aggregated item, no changes will apply. If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

properties.name: upperCase
properties.description: Determines whether the text of the icon tab filter (not the count) is displayed in uppercase.

properties.name: stretchContentHeight
properties.description: Determines whether the IconTabBar height is stretched to the maximum possible height of its parent container. As a prerequisite, the height of the parent container must be defined as a fixed value.

properties.name: applyContentPadding
properties.description: Determines whether the IconTabBar content fits to the full area. The paddings are removed if it's set to false.

properties.name: backgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the IconTabBar.

Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid".

properties.name: headerMode
properties.description: Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set.

properties.name: showOverflowSelectList
properties.description:
Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed.

The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed, so the user can select specific tab filter easier.

properties.name: headerBackgroundDesign
properties.description:
Specifies the background color of the header.

Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid".

properties.name: enableTabReordering
properties.description: Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: The items displayed in the IconTabBar.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Represents the contents displayed below the IconTabBar. If there are multiple contents, they are rendered after each other. The developer has to manage to display the right one or use the content aggregation inside the IconTabFilter (which will be displayed instead if it is set).

methods.name: getApplyContentPadding

returnValue.description: Value of property applyContentPadding

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getApplyContentPadding applyContentPadding}. Determines whether the IconTabBar content fits to the full area. The paddings are removed if it's set to false. Default value is true.

methods.name: getBackgroundDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property backgroundDesign

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundDesign backgroundDesign}. Specifies the background color of the IconTabBar. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". Default value is Solid.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Represents the contents displayed below the IconTabBar. If there are multiple contents, they are rendered after each other. The developer has to manage to display the right one or use the content aggregation inside the IconTabFilter (which will be displayed instead if it is set).

methods.name: getEnableTabReordering

returnValue.description: Value of property enableTabReordering

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableTabReordering enableTabReordering}. Specifies whether tab reordering is enabled. Relevant only for desktop devices. Default value is false.

methods.name: getExpandable

returnValue.description: Value of property expandable

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getExpandable expandable}. Defines if the tabs are collapsible and expandable. Default value is true.

methods.name: getExpanded

returnValue.description: Value of property expanded

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getExpanded expanded}. Indicates if the actual tab content is expanded or not. Default value is true.

methods.name: getHeaderBackgroundDesign

returnValue.description: Value of property headerBackgroundDesign

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderBackgroundDesign headerBackgroundDesign}. Specifies the background color of the header. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background color to "Solid", "Translucent", or "Transparent". Default is "Solid". Default value is Solid.

methods.name: getHeaderMode

returnValue.description: Value of property headerMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeaderMode headerMode}. Specifies the header mode. Note: The Inline mode works only if no icons are set. Default value is Standard.

methods.name: getItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getItems items}.

The items displayed in the IconTabBar.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.IconTabBar.

methods.name: getSelectedKey

returnValue.description: Value of property selectedKey

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}.

Key of the selected tab item.

If the key has no corresponding aggregated item, no changes will apply. If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

methods.name: getSelectedKey

returnValue.description: The current property value.

methods.description: Reflector for the internal header's selectedKey property.

methods.name: getShowOverflowSelectList

returnValue.description: Value of property showOverflowSelectList

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowOverflowSelectList showOverflowSelectList}. Specifies if the overflow select list is displayed. The overflow select list represents a list, where all tab filters are displayed, so the user can select specific tab filter easier. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property showSelection

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSelection showSelection}. Defines whether the current selection should be visualized. Default value is true.

methods.name: getStretchContentHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property stretchContentHeight

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStretchContentHeight stretchContentHeight}. Determines whether the IconTabBar height is stretched to the maximum possible height of its parent container. As a prerequisite, the height of the parent container must be defined as a fixed value. Default value is false.

methods.name: getUpperCase

returnValue.description: Value of property upperCase

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUpperCase upperCase}. Determines whether the text of the icon tab filter (not the count) is displayed in uppercase. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.m.IconTabFilter
symbols.description: Represents a selectable item inside an IconTabBar.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Represents the "count" text, which is displayed in the tab filter.

properties.name: showAll
properties.description: Enables special visualization for disabled filter (show all items). Note: You can use this property when you use IconTabBar as a filter. In order for it to be displayed correctly, the other tabs in the filter should consist of an icon, text and an optional count. It can be set to true for the first tab filter. You can find more detailed guidelines at https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/icontabbar/#tabs-as-filters.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Specifies the icon to be displayed for the tab filter.

properties.name: iconColor
properties.description:
Specifies the icon color.

If an icon font is used, the color can be chosen from the icon colors (sap.ui.core.IconColor). Possible semantic colors are: Neutral, Positive, Critical, Negative. Instead of the semantic icon color the brand color can be used, this is named Default. Semantic colors and brand colors should not be mixed up inside one IconTabBar.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description:
If set to true, it sends one or more requests, trying to get the density perfect version of the image if this version of the image doesn't exist on the server. Default value is set to true.

If bandwidth is key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Specifies whether the tab filter is rendered.

properties.name: design
properties.description: Specifies whether the icon and the texts are placed vertically or horizontally.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
The content displayed for this item (optional).

If this content is set, it is displayed instead of the general content inside the IconTabBar.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.Image
symbols.description:
A wrapper around the IMG tag. The image can be loaded from a remote or local server.

Density related image will be loaded if image with density awareness name in format [imageName]@[densityValue].[extension] is provided. The valid desity values are 1, 1.5, 2. If the original devicePixelRatio isn't one of the three valid numbers, it's rounded up to the nearest one.

There are various size setting options available, and the images can be combined with actions.

From version 1.30, new image mode sap.m.ImageMode.Background is added. When this mode is set, the src property is set using the css style 'background-image'. The properties 'backgroundSize', 'backgroundPosition', 'backgroundRepeat' have effect only when image is in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. In order to make the high density image correctly displayed, the 'backgroundSize' should be set to the dimension of the normal density version.

properties.name: src
properties.description: Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored. The path will be adapted to the density aware format according to the density of the device following the convention that [imageName]@[densityValue].[extension]

properties.name: width
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the original ratio between width/height is maintained. When 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, this property always needs to be set. Otherwise the output DOM element has a 0 size.

properties.name: height
properties.description: When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the original ratio between width/height is maintained. When 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, this property always needs to be set. Otherwise the output DOM element has a 0 size.

properties.name: decorative
properties.description:
A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images.

Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative.

properties.name: alt
properties.description: The alternative text that is displayed in case the Image is not available, or cannot be displayed. If the image is set to decorative this property is ignored.

properties.name: useMap
properties.description: The name of the image map that defines the clickable areas

properties.name: densityAware
properties.description:
If this is set to false, the src image will be loaded directly without attempting to fetch the density perfect image for high density device.

By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server.

If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false.

properties.name: activeSrc
properties.description: The source property which is used when the image is pressed.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Defines how the src and the activeSrc is output to the Dom Element. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Image which is the default value, the src (activeSrc) is set to the 'src' attribute of the 'img' tag. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, the src (activeSrc) is set to the CSS style 'background-image' and the root DOM element is rendered as a 'span' tag instead of an 'img' tag.

properties.name: backgroundSize
properties.description: Defines the size of the image in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-size'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

properties.name: backgroundPosition
properties.description: Defines the position of the image in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-position'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

properties.name: backgroundRepeat
properties.description: Defines whether the source image is repeated when the output DOM element is bigger than the source. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-repeat'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background.

aggregations.name: detailBox
aggregations.description: A sap.m.LightBox instance, that will be opened automatically when the user interacts with the Image control. The tap event will still be fired.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledBy).

events.description: Event is fired when the image resource is loaded.

events.name: error
events.description: Event is fired when the image resource can't be loaded. If densityAware is set to true, the event is fired when none of the fallback resources can be loaded.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundRepeat backgroundRepeat}. Defines whether the source image is repeated when the output DOM element is bigger than the source. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-repeat'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background. Default value is no-repeat.

methods.name: getBackgroundSize

returnValue.description: Value of property backgroundSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getBackgroundSize backgroundSize}. Defines the size of the image in sap.m.ImageMode.Background mode. This property is set on the output DOM element using CSS style 'background-size'. This property takes effect only when the 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background. Default value is cover.

methods.name: getDecorative

returnValue.description: Value of property decorative

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDecorative decorative}. A decorative image is included for design reasons. Accessibility tools will ignore decorative images. Note: If the Image has an image map (useMap is set), this property will be overridden (the image will not be rendered as decorative). A decorative image has no ALT attribute, so the Alt property is ignored if the image is decorative. Default value is true.

methods.name: getDensityAware

returnValue.description: Value of property densityAware

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDensityAware densityAware}. If this is set to false, the src image will be loaded directly without attempting to fetch the density perfect image for high density device. By default, this is set to true but then one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If bandwidth is the key for the application, set this value to false. Default value is true.

methods.name: getDetailBox
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDetailBox detailBox}. A sap.m.LightBox instance, that will be opened automatically when the user interacts with the Image control. The tap event will still be fired.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

When the empty value is kept, the original size is not changed. It is also possible to make settings for width or height only, the original ratio between width/height is maintained. When 'mode' property is set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, this property always needs to be set. Otherwise the output DOM element has a 0 size.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.Image.

methods.name: getMode

returnValue.description: Value of property mode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMode mode}. Defines how the src and the activeSrc is output to the Dom Element. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Image which is the default value, the src (activeSrc) is set to the 'src' attribute of the 'img' tag. When set to sap.m.ImageMode.Background, the src (activeSrc) is set to the CSS style 'background-image' and the root DOM element is rendered as a 'span' tag instead of an 'img' tag. Default value is Image.

methods.name: getSrc

returnValue.description: Value of property src

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSrc src}.

Relative or absolute path to URL where the image file is stored. The path will be adapted to the density aware format according to the density of the device following the convention that [imageName]@[densityValue].[extension]

methods.name: getUseMap

methods.description:

methods.name: getWidth

symbols.name: sap.m.Input
symbols.description:
Allows the user to enter and edit text or numeric values in one line.

Overview

You can enable the autocomplete suggestion feature and the value help option to easily enter a valid value.

Guidelines

  • Always provide a meaningful label for any input field
  • Limit the length of the input field. This will visually emphasize the constraints for the field.
  • Do not use the placeholder property as a label.
  • Use the description property only for small fields with no placeholders (i.e. for currencies).

Structure

The controls inherits from {@link sap.m.InputBase} which controls the core properties like:
  • editable / read-only
  • enabled / disabled
  • placeholder
  • text direction
  • value states
To aid the user during input, you can enable value help (showValueHelp) or autocomplete (showSuggestion). Value help will open a new dialog where you can refine your input. Autocomplete has three types of suggestions:
  • Single value - a list of suggestions of type sap.ui.core.Item or sap.ui.core.ListItem
  • Two values - a list of two suggestions (ID and description) of type sap.ui.core.Item or sap.ui.core.ListItem
  • Tabular suggestions of type sap.m.ColumnListItem
The suggestions are stored in two aggregations suggestionItems (for single and double values) and suggestionRows (for tabular values).

Usage

When to use: Use the control for short inputs like emails, phones, passwords, fields for assisted value selection. When not to use: Don't use the control for long texts, dates, designated search fields, fields for multiple selection.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates.

properties.name: maxLength
properties.description: Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored.

properties.name: dateFormat
properties.description: Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. NOTE: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd).

deprecated.text: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired.

properties.name: showSuggestion
properties.description: If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input.

properties.name: valueHelpOnly
properties.description: If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect

properties.name: filterSuggests
properties.description: Defines whether to filter the provided suggestions before showing them to the user.

properties.name: maxSuggestionWidth
properties.description: If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.

properties.name: startSuggestion
properties.description: Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus.

properties.name: showTableSuggestionValueHelp
properties.description:
For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true.

NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect.

properties.name: description
properties.description: The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies.

properties.name: fieldWidth
properties.description: This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description.

properties.name: valueLiveUpdate
properties.description: Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false).

properties.name: selectedKey
properties.description: Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used.

properties.name: textFormatMode
properties.description: Defines the display text format mode.

properties.name: textFormatter
properties.description: Defines the display text formatter function.

properties.name: suggestionRowValidator
properties.description: Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected.

properties.name: enableSuggestionsHighlighting
properties.description: Specifies whether the suggestions highlighting is enabled.

aggregations.name: suggestionItems
aggregations.description: SuggestItems are the items which will be shown in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, destroySuggestionItems) after input is rendered will open/close the suggestion popup. o display suggestions with two text values, it is also possible to add sap.ui.core/ListItems as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field.

aggregations.name: suggestionColumns
aggregations.description: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

aggregations.name: suggestionRows
aggregations.description: The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table cells. The items of this aggregation are to be bound directly or to set in the suggest event method. Note: If this aggregation is filled, the aggregation suggestionItems will be ignored.

aggregations.name: _valueHelpIcon
aggregations.description: The icon on the right side of the Input

associations.name: selectedItem
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected item from the suggestionItems.

associations.name: selectedRow
associations.description: Sets or retrieves the selected row from the suggestionRows.

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event is fired when the value of the input is changed - e.g. at each keypress

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input.

escPressed.name: escPressed
escPressed.description: Indicate that ESC key triggered the event.

previousValue.name: previousValue
previousValue.description: The value of the input before pressing ESC key.

events.name: valueHelpRequest
events.description: When the value help indicator is clicked, this event will be fired.

fromSuggestions.name: fromSuggestions
fromSuggestions.description: The event parameter is set to true, when the button at the end of the suggestion table is clicked, otherwise false. It can be used to determine whether the "value help" trigger or the "show all items" trigger has been pressed.

events.name: suggest
events.description: This event is fired when user types in the input and showSuggestion is set to true. Changing the suggestItems aggregation will show the suggestions within a popup.

suggestValue.name: suggestValue
suggestValue.description: The current value which has been typed in the input.

suggestionColumns.name: suggestionColumns
suggestionColumns.description: The suggestion list is passed to this event for convenience. If you use list-based or tabular suggestions, fill the suggestionList with the items you want to suggest. Otherwise, directly add the suggestions to the "suggestionItems" aggregation of the input control.

events.name: suggestionItemSelected
events.description: This event is fired when suggestionItem shown in suggestion popup are selected. This event is only fired when showSuggestion is set to true and there are suggestionItems shown in the suggestion popup.

selectedItem.name: selectedItem
selectedItem.description: This is the item selected in the suggestion popup for one and two-value suggestions. For tabular suggestions, this value will not be set.

selectedRow.name: selectedRow
selectedRow.description:
This is the row selected in the tabular suggestion popup represented as a ColumnListItem. For one and two-value suggestions, this value will not be set.

Note: The row result function to select a result value for the string is already executed at this time. To pick different value for the input field or to do follow up steps after the item has been selected.

events.name: submit
events.description: This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter. The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

properties.name: setFilterFunction
properties.description: Sets a custom filter function for suggestions. The default is to check whether the first item text begins with the typed value. For one and two-value suggestions this callback function will operate on sap.ui.core.Item types, for tabular suggestions the function will operate on sap.m.ColumnListItem types.

properties.name: setSelectedItem
properties.description: Sets the selectedItem association.

properties.name: setSelectedKey
properties.description: Sets the selectedKey property. Default value is an empty string "" or undefined.

properties.name: setSelectedRow
properties.description: Sets the selectedRow association. Default value is null.

properties.name: setWidth
properties.description: Defines the width of the input. Default value is 100%.

events.description: This event is fired when the value of the input is changed - e.g. at each keypress

events.name: submit

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input.

events.description: This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter. The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

events.name: suggest

suggestValue.name: suggestValue
suggestValue.description: The current value which has been typed in the input.

suggestionColumns.name: suggestionColumns
suggestionColumns.description: The suggestion list is passed to this event for convenience. If you use list-based or tabular suggestions, fill the suggestionList with the items you want to suggest. Otherwise, directly add the suggestions to the "suggestionItems" aggregation of the input control.

events.description: This event is fired when user types in the input and showSuggestion is set to true. Changing the suggestItems aggregation will show the suggestions within a popup.

events.name: suggestionItemSelected

selectedItem.name: selectedItem
selectedItem.description: This is the item selected in the suggestion popup for one and two-value suggestions. For tabular suggestions, this value will not be set.

selectedRow.name: selectedRow
selectedRow.description:
This is the row selected in the tabular suggestion popup represented as a ColumnListItem. For one and two-value suggestions, this value will not be set.

Note: The row result function to select a result value for the string is already executed at this time. To pick different value for the input field or to do follow up steps after the item has been selected.

events.description: This event is fired when suggestionItem shown in suggestion popup are selected. This event is only fired when showSuggestion is set to true and there are suggestionItems shown in the suggestion popup.

events.name: valueHelpRequest

fromSuggestions.name: fromSuggestions
fromSuggestions.description: The event parameter is set to true, when the button at the end of the suggestion table is clicked, otherwise false. It can be used to determine whether the "value help" trigger or the "show all items" trigger has been pressed.

events.description: When the value help indicator is clicked, this event will be fired.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.m.Input itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:submit submit} event of this sap.m.Input. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.Input itself. This event is fired when user presses the Enter key on the input. Note: The event is fired independent of whether there was a change before or not. If a change was performed the event is fired after the change event. The event is also fired when an item of the select list is selected via Enter. The event is only fired on an input which allows text input (editable, enabled and not valueHelpOnly).

methods.name: getAccessibilityInfo

returnValue.description: Accesibility information.

methods.description: Gets accessibility information for the input.

methods.name: getDateFormat

returnValue.description: Value of property dateFormat

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDateFormat dateFormat}. Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. NOTE: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd). Default value is YYYY-MM-dd.

deprecated.text: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

methods.name: getDescription

returnValue.description: Value of property description

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDescription description}.

The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies.

methods.name: getDOMValue

returnValue.description: The value of the input.

methods.description: Gets the inner input DOM value.

methods.name: getEnableSuggestionsHighlighting

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSuggestionsHighlighting

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSuggestionsHighlighting enableSuggestionsHighlighting}. Specifies whether the suggestions highlighting is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFieldWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property fieldWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFieldWidth fieldWidth}. This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description. Default value is 50%.

methods.name: getFilterSuggests

returnValue.description: Value of property filterSuggests

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterSuggests filterSuggests}. Defines whether to filter the provided suggestions before showing them to the user. Default value is true.

methods.name: getMaxLength

returnValue.description: Value of property maxLength

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxLength maxLength}. Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored. Default value is 0.

methods.name: getMaxSuggestionWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property maxSuggestionWidth

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxSuggestionWidth maxSuggestionWidth}.

If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.m.Input.

methods.name: getSelectedItem
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem}, or null.

methods.name: getSelectedKey

returnValue.description: Value of property selectedKey

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}. Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getSelectedRow
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getSelectedRow selectedRow}, or null.

methods.name: getShowSuggestion

returnValue.description: Value of property showSuggestion

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowSuggestion showSuggestion}. If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowTableSuggestionValueHelp

returnValue.description: Value of property showTableSuggestionValueHelp

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowTableSuggestionValueHelp showTableSuggestionValueHelp}. For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true. NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShowValueHelp

returnValue.description: Value of property showValueHelp

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowValueHelp showValueHelp}. If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowValueStateMessage

returnValue.description: the value of property showValueStateMessage

methods.description: Getter for property showValueStateMessage. Whether the value state message should be shown. This property is already available for sap.m.Input since 1.16.0. Default value is true

methods.name: getStartSuggestion

returnValue.description: Value of property startSuggestion

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStartSuggestion startSuggestion}. Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. Default value is 1.

methods.name: getSuggestionColumns
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSuggestionColumns suggestionColumns}.

The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table columns; for more details see the aggregation "suggestionRows".

methods.name: getSuggestionItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSuggestionItems suggestionItems}.

SuggestItems are the items which will be shown in the suggestion popup. Changing this aggregation (by calling addSuggestionItem, insertSuggestionItem, removeSuggestionItem, removeAllSuggestionItems, destroySuggestionItems) after input is rendered will open/close the suggestion popup. o display suggestions with two text values, it is also possible to add sap.ui.core/ListItems as SuggestionItems (since 1.21.1). For the selected ListItem, only the first value is returned to the input field.

methods.name: getSuggestionRows
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSuggestionRows suggestionRows}.

The suggestionColumns and suggestionRows are for tabular input suggestions. This aggregation allows for binding the table cells. The items of this aggregation are to be bound directly or to set in the suggest event method. Note: If this aggregation is filled, the aggregation suggestionItems will be ignored.

methods.name: getSuggestionRowValidator

returnValue.description: Value of property suggestionRowValidator

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSuggestionRowValidator suggestionRowValidator}. Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getTextFormatMode

returnValue.description: Value of property textFormatMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextFormatMode textFormatMode}. Defines the display text format mode. Default value is Value.

methods.name: getTextFormatter

returnValue.description: Value of property textFormatter

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextFormatter textFormatter}. Defines the display text formatter function. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getType

returnValue.description: Value of property type

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getType type}. HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates. Default value is Text.

methods.name: getValue

returnValue.description: Value of the input.

methods.description: Gets the input value.

methods.name: getValueHelpOnly

returnValue.description: Value of property valueHelpOnly

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValueHelpOnly valueHelpOnly}. If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect Default value is false.

methods.name: getValueLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Value of property valueLiveUpdate

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValueLiveUpdate valueLiveUpdate}. Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false). Default value is false.

methods.name: getValueStateText

returnValue.description: the value of property valueStateText

methods.description: Getter for property valueStateText. The text which is shown in the value state message popup. If not specfied a default text is shown. This property is already available for sap.m.Input since 1.16.0. Default value is empty/undefined

methods.name: setDateFormat

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDateFormat
parameters.description: New value for property dateFormat

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDateFormat dateFormat}. Only used if type=date and no datepicker is available. The data is displayed and the user input is parsed according to this format. NOTE: The value property is always of the form RFC 3339 (YYYY-MM-dd). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is YYYY-MM-dd.

deprecated.text: sap.m.DatePicker, sap.m.TimePicker or sap.m.DateTimePicker should be used for date/time inputs and formating.

methods.name: setDescription

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.description: New value for property description

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDescription description}. The description is a text after the input field, e.g. units of measurement, currencies. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setDOMValue

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Dom value which will be set.

methods.description: Sets the inner input DOM value.

methods.name: setEnableSuggestionsHighlighting

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bEnableSuggestionsHighlighting
parameters.description: New value for property enableSuggestionsHighlighting

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableSuggestionsHighlighting enableSuggestionsHighlighting}. Specifies whether the suggestions highlighting is enabled. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setFieldWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sFieldWidth
parameters.description: New value for property fieldWidth

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFieldWidth fieldWidth}. This property only takes effect if the description property is set. It controls the distribution of space between the input field and the description text. The default value is 50% leaving the other 50% for the description. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 50%.

methods.name: setFilterSuggests

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bFilterSuggests
parameters.description: New value for property filterSuggests

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getFilterSuggests filterSuggests}. Defines whether to filter the provided suggestions before showing them to the user. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setMaxLength

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxLength
parameters.description: New value for property maxLength

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxLength maxLength}. Maximum number of characters. Value '0' means the feature is switched off. This parameter is not compatible with the input type sap.m.InputType.Number. If the input type is set to Number, the maxLength value is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

methods.name: setMaxSuggestionWidth

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sMaxSuggestionWidth
parameters.description: New value for property maxSuggestionWidth

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getMaxSuggestionWidth maxSuggestionWidth}. If set, the value of this parameter will control the horizontal size of the suggestion list to display more data. This allows suggestion lists to be wider than the input field if there is enough space available. By default, the suggestion list is always as wide as the input field. Note: The value will be ignored if the actual width of the input field is larger than the specified parameter value. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.name: setRowResultFunction

returnValue.description: this pointer for chaining

parameters.name: fnFilter
parameters.description: The result function is called with one parameter: the sap.m.ColumnListItem that is selected. The function must return a result string that will be displayed as the input field's value.

methods.description: Sets a custom result filter function for tabular suggestions to select the text that is passed to the input field. Default is to check whether the first cell with a "text" property begins with the typed value. For one value and two-value suggestions this callback function is not called.

methods.name: setSelectedItem

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSelectedItem
parameters.description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this selectedItem association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

methods.description: Sets the associated {@link #getSelectedItem selectedItem}.

methods.name: setSelectedKey

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sSelectedKey
parameters.description: New value for property selectedKey

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectedKey selectedKey}. Defines the key of the selected item. Note: If duplicate keys exist, the first item matching the key is used. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setSelectedRow

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSelectedRow
parameters.description: ID of an element which becomes the new target of this selectedRow association; alternatively, an element instance may be given

methods.description: Sets the associated {@link #getSelectedRow selectedRow}.

methods.name: setShowSuggestion

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowSuggestion
parameters.description: New value for property showSuggestion

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowSuggestion showSuggestion}. If this is set to true, suggest event is fired when user types in the input. Changing the suggestItems aggregation in suggest event listener will show suggestions within a popup. When runs on phone, input will first open a dialog where the input and suggestions are shown. When runs on a tablet, the suggestions are shown in a popup next to the input. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowSuggestion

returnValue.description: this Input instance for chaining.

parameters.name: bValue
parameters.description: Show suggestions.

methods.description: Shows suggestions.

methods.name: setShowTableSuggestionValueHelp

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowTableSuggestionValueHelp
parameters.description: New value for property showTableSuggestionValueHelp

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowTableSuggestionValueHelp showTableSuggestionValueHelp}. For tabular suggestions, this flag will show/hide the button at the end of the suggestion table that triggers the event "valueHelpRequest" when pressed. The default value is true. NOTE: If suggestions are not tabular or no suggestions are used, the button will not be displayed and this flag is without effect. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowTableSuggestionValueHelp

returnValue.description: this Input instance for chaining.

parameters.name: bValue
parameters.description: Show suggestions.

methods.description: Shows value help suggestions in table.

methods.name: setShowValueHelp

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowValueHelp
parameters.description: New value for property showValueHelp

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowValueHelp showValueHelp}. If set to true, a value help indicator will be displayed inside the control. When clicked the event "valueHelpRequest" will be fired. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowValueStateMessage

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowValueStateMessage
parameters.description: new value for property showValueStateMessage

methods.description: Setter for property showValueStateMessage. Default value is true

methods.name: setStartSuggestion

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iStartSuggestion
parameters.description: New value for property startSuggestion

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStartSuggestion startSuggestion}. Minimum length of the entered text in input before suggest event is fired. The default value is 1 which means the suggest event is fired after user types in input. When it's set to 0, suggest event is fired when input with no text gets focus. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

methods.name: setSuggestionRowValidator

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSuggestionRowValidator
parameters.description: New value for property suggestionRowValidator

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSuggestionRowValidator suggestionRowValidator}. Defines the validation callback function called when a suggestion row gets selected. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setTextFormatMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTextFormatMode
parameters.description: New value for property textFormatMode

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTextFormatMode textFormatMode}. Defines the display text format mode. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Value.

methods.name: setTextFormatter

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oTextFormatter
parameters.description: New value for property textFormatter

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTextFormatter textFormatter}. Defines the display text formatter function. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sType
parameters.description: New value for property type

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getType type}. HTML type of the internal input tag (e.g. Text, Number, Email, Phone). The particular effect of this property differs depending on the browser and the current language settings, especially for the type Number.
This parameter is intended to be used with touch devices that use different soft keyboard layouts depending on the given input type.
Only the default value sap.m.InputType.Text may be used in combination with data model formats. sap.ui.model defines extended formats that are mostly incompatible with normal HTML representations for numbers and dates. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Text.
