returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: sValue
parameters.description: New value for property value.

methods.description: Setter for property value. Default value is empty/undefined.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValueHelpOnly
parameters.description: New value for property valueHelpOnly

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueHelpOnly valueHelpOnly}. If set to true, direct text input is disabled and the control will trigger the event "valueHelpRequest" for all user interactions. The properties "showValueHelp", "editable", and "enabled" must be set to true, otherwise the property will have no effect When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setValueLiveUpdate

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValueLiveUpdate
parameters.description: New value for property valueLiveUpdate

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValueLiveUpdate valueLiveUpdate}. Indicates when the value gets updated with the user changes: At each keystroke (true) or first when the user presses enter or tabs out (false). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.m.InputBase
symbols.description: The sap.m.InputBase control provides a basic functionality for input controls.

properties.name: value
properties.description: Defines the value of the control.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Indicates whether the user can interact with the control or not. Note: Disabled controls cannot be focused and they are out of the tab-chain.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, e.g. Error, Warning, Success.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Defines the name of the control for the purposes of form submission.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.

properties.name: editable
properties.description: Defines whether the control can be modified by the user or not. Note: A user can tab to non-editable control, highlight it, and copy the text from it.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this is not specified, a default text is shown from the resource bundle.

properties.name: showValueStateMessage
properties.description: Indicates whether the value state message should be shown or not.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Defines the text directionality of the input field, e.g. RTL, LTR

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required. This property is only needed for accessibility purposes when a single relationship between the field and a label (see aggregation labelFor of sap.m.Label) cannot be established (e.g. one label should label multiple fields).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: change
events.description: Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the control.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new sap.m.InputBase. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

properties.name: bShowLabelAsPlaceholder
properties.description: Use labels as placeholder configuration. It can be necessary for the subclasses to overwrite this when native placeholder usage causes undesired input events or when placeholder attribute is not supported for the specified type. https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#input-type-attr-summary

events.name: change

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the control.

events.description: Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.m.InputBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.InputBase itself. Is fired when the text in the input field has changed and the focus leaves the input field or the enter key is pressed.

symbols.name: sap.m.InputODataSuggestProvider
symbols.description:
Suggestion helper for sap.m.Input fields: Creates a multi column suggest list for an sap.m.Input field based on a ValueList annotation. The ValueList annotation will be resolved via the binding information of the Input field.

If the annotation describes multiple input parameter the suggest provider will resolve all of these relative to the context of the Input filed and use them for the suggestion query. The suggest provider will write all values that are described as output parameters back to the model (relative to the context of the Input field). This can only be done if the model runs in "TwoWay" binding mode. Both features can be switched of via the bResolveInput/bResolveOutput parameter of the suggest function:

symbols.name: sap.m.IOverflowToolbarContent
symbols.description:
Interface for controls which can have special behavior inside sap.m.OverflowToolbar. Controls that implement this interface must provide a getOverflowToolbarConfig method that accepts no arguments and returns an object with the following fields:
  • canOverflow - A boolean that tells whether the control can move to the overflow menu or not. Note: Even if canOverflow is set to false, the propsUnrelatedToSize field is taken into account, allowing to optimize the behavior of controls that do not need to overflow, but are used in an sap.m.OverflowToolbar regardless.
  • autoCloseEvents - An array of strings, listing all of the control's events that should trigger the closing of the overflow menu, when fired.
  • propsUnrelatedToSize - An array of strings, listing all of the control's properties that, when changed, should not cause the overflow toolbar to invalidate. Note: By default sap.m.OverflowToolbar invalidates whenever any property of a child control changes. This is to ensure that whenever the size of a child control changes, the overflow toolbar's layout is recalculated. Some properties however do not affect control size, making it unnecessary to invalidate the overflow toolbar when they change. You can list them here for optimization purposes.
  • onBeforeEnterOverflow(oControl) - A callback function that will be invoked before moving the control into the overflow menu. The control instance will be passed as an argument. Note: The context of the function is not the control instance (use the oControl parameter for this purpose), but rather an internal helper object, associated with the current sap.m.OverflowToolbar instance. This object only needs to be manipulated in special cases (e.g. when you want to store state on it, rather than on the control instance).
  • onAfterExitOverflow(oControl) - A callback function that will be invoked after taking the control out of the overflow menu (before moving it back to the toolbar itself). The control instance will be passed as an argument. Note: See: onBeforeEnterOverflow for details about the function's context.
  • getCustomImportance() - A function that, if provided, will be called to determine the priority of the control. This function must return a value of type sap.m.OverflowToolbarPriority. The string "Medium" is also accepted and interpreted as priority between Low and High. Note: Normally priority in sap.m.OverflowToolbar is managed with the priority property of sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData. However, some controls may have other means of defining priority, such as dedicated properties or other types of layout data for that purpose. In summary, implementing this function allows a control to override the default priority logic (sap.m.OverflowToolbarLayoutData) by providing its own.
Important: In addition, the control can implement a CSS class, scoped with the .sapMOverflowToolbarMenu-CTX context selector, that will be applied whenever the control is inside the overflow menu. For example, to make your control take up the whole width of the overflow menu, you can add a context class to your control's base CSS file like this: 
      .sapMOverflowToolbarMenu-CTX .sapMyControlClass {
      	width: 100%;
      }

symbols.name: sap.m.Label
symbols.description:
Provides a textual label for other controls. Label appearance can be influenced by properties such as textAlign, design, displayOnly and wrapping. As of version 1.50 the default value of the wrapping property is set to false Labels for required fields are marked with an asterisk.

Overview

Labels are used as titles for single controls or groups of controls.

Usage

When to use

  • It's recommended to use the Label in Form controls.
  • Use title case for labels.

When not to use

  • It is not recommended to use labels in Bold.

properties.description: Sets the design of a Label to either Standard or Bold.

properties.description: Determines the Label text to be displayed.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Available alignment settings are "Begin", "Center", "End", "Left", and "Right".

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Options for the text direction are RTL and LTR. Alternatively, the control can inherit the text direction from its parent container.

properties.description: Determines the width of the label.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required for input control labeled by the sap.m.Label. When the property is set to true and associated input field is empty an asterisk character is added to the label text.

properties.name: displayOnly
properties.description: Determines if the label is in displayOnly mode. Controls in this mode are neither interactive, nor editable, nor focusable, and not in the tab chain. Note: This property should be used only in Form controls in preview mode.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines the wrapping of the text within the Label. If set to true the Label will wrap, when set to false the Label will be truncated and replaced with ellipsis which is the default behavior.

properties.name: vAlign
properties.description: Specifies the vertical alignment of the Label related to the tallest and lowest element on the line.

symbols.name: sap.m.LightBox
symbols.description:
Represents a popup containing an image and a footer.

Overview

The purpose of the control is to display an image in its original size as long as this is possible. On smaller screens images are scaled down to fit. Notes:
  • If the image doesn't load in 10 seconds, an error is displayed.
  • Setting the imageContent aggregation of the control as well as the source of the image and the title of the image is mandatory. If the image source is not set, the control will not open.

Structure

Each LightBox holds a {@link sap.m.LightBoxItem LightBoxItem} which keeps the properties of the image:
  • imageSrc - The source URI of the image
  • title - The title of the image
  • subtitle - The subtitle of the image
  • alt - The alt text of the image

Usage

The most common use case is to click on an image thumbnail to view it in bigger size. When the image that should be displayed in the control cannot be loaded, an error is displayed in the popup.

Responsive Behavior

On a mobile device, flipping the device to landscape will flip the lightbox and the image will be adjusted to fit the new dimensions.

Additional Information

Check out the API Reference.

aggregations.name: imageContent
aggregations.description: Aggregation which holds data about the image and its description. Although multiple LightBoxItems may be added to this aggregation only the first one in the list will be taken into account.

aggregations.name: _closeButton
aggregations.description: The close button aggregation inside the LightBox control. This button has to have text in it.

aggregations.name: _errorIcon
aggregations.description: The error icon displayed when the image could not be loaded in time.

aggregations.name: _errorTitle
aggregations.description: The main error message displayed when the image could not be loaded.

aggregations.name: _errorSubtitle
aggregations.description: The detailed error message displayed when the image could not be loaded.

aggregations.name: _verticalLayout
aggregations.description: A layout control used to display the error texts when the image could not be loaded.

aggregations.name: _invisiblePopupText
aggregations.description: Hidden text used for accessibility of the popup.

aggregations.name: _busy
aggregations.description: BusyIndicator for loading state.

symbols.name: sap.m.Link
symbols.description:
A hyperlink control used to navigate to other apps and web pages or to trigger actions.

Overview

The Link control is a clickable text element visualized in such a way that it stands out from the standard text. On hover, it changes its style to underlined text to provide additional feedback to the user.

Usage

You can set the Link to be enabled or disabled. To create a visual hierarchy in large lists of links, you can set the less important links as subtle or the more important ones as emphasized. To specify where the linked content is opened, you can use the target property.

Responsive behavior

If there is not enough space, the text of the Link becomes truncated. If the wrapping property is set to true, the text will be displayed on several lines, instead of being truncated.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Defines the displayed link text.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: Determines whether the link can be triggered by the user.

properties.name: target
properties.description: Specifies a target where the linked content will open. Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. This property is only used when the href property is set.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Determines the width of the link (CSS-size such as % or px). When it is set, this is the exact size. When left blank, the text defines the size.

properties.name: href
properties.description: Defines the link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the press event should be registered.

properties.name: validateUrl
properties.description: Defines whether the link target URI should be validated. If validation fails, the value of the href property will still be set, but will not be applied to the DOM. Note: Additional whitelisting of URLs is allowed through {@link jQuery.sap/methods/jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist jQuery.sap.addUrlWhitelist}.

properties.name: wrapping
properties.description: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is no sufficient space.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Determines the horizontal alignment of the text.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: This property specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the parent DOM.

properties.name: subtle
properties.description: Subtle links look more like standard text than like links. They should only be used to help with visual hierarchy between large data lists of important and less important links. Subtle links should not be used in any other use case.

properties.name: emphasized
properties.description: Emphasized links look visually more important than regular links.

symbols.name: sap.m.List
symbols.description: The List control provides a container for all types of list items. For mobile devices, the recommended limit of list items is 100 to assure proper performance. To improve initial rendering of large lists, use the "growing" feature. Please refer to the SAPUI5 Developer Guide for more information.. See section "{@link topic:1da158152f644ba1ad408a3e982fd3df Lists}" in the documentation for an introduction to sap.m.List control.

properties.description: Sets the background style of the list. Depending on the theme, you can change the state of the background from Solid to Translucent or to Transparent.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListBase
symbols.description: The sap.m.ListBase control provides a base functionality of the sap.m.List and sap.m.Table controls. Selection, deletion, unread states and inset style are also maintained in sap.m.ListBase. See section "{@link topic:295e44b2d0144318bcb7bdd56bfa5189 List, List Item, and Table}" in the documentation for an introduction to subclasses of sap.m.ListBase control. Note: The ListBase including all contained items may be completely re-rendered when the data of a bound model is changed. Due to the limited hardware resources of mobile devices this can lead to longer delays for lists that contain many items. As such the usage of a list is not recommended for these use cases.

properties.name: inset
properties.description: Defines the indentation of the container. Setting it to true indents the list.

properties.name: headerText
properties.description: Defines the header text that appears in the control. Note: If headerToolbar aggregation is set, then this property is ignored.

properties.name: headerDesign
properties.description: Defines the header style of the control. Possible values are Standard and Plain.

deprecated.text: No longer has any functionality.

properties.name: footerText
properties.description: Defines the footer text that appears in the control.

properties.name: mode
properties.description: Defines the mode of the control (e.g. None, SingleSelect, MultiSelect, Delete).

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the control.

properties.name: includeItemInSelection
properties.description: Defines whether the items are selectable by clicking on the item itself (true) rather than having to set the selection control first. Note: The SingleSelectMaster mode also provides this functionality by default.

properties.name: showUnread
properties.description: Activates the unread indicator for all items, if set to true.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: This text is displayed when the control contains no items.

properties.name: showNoData
properties.description: Defines whether or not the text specified in the noDataText property is displayed.

properties.name: enableBusyIndicator
properties.description: When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property.

properties.name: modeAnimationOn
properties.description: Defines if animations will be shown while switching between modes.

properties.name: showSeparators
properties.description: Defines which item separator style will be used.

properties.name: swipeDirection
properties.description: Defines the direction of the swipe movement (e.g LeftToRight, RightToLeft, Both) to display the control defined in the swipeContent aggregation.

properties.name: growing
properties.description: If set to true, enables the growing feature of the control to load more items by requesting from the model. Note:: This feature only works when an items aggregation is bound. Growing must not be used together with two-way binding.

properties.name: growingThreshold
properties.description: Defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

properties.name: growingTriggerText
properties.description: Defines the text displayed on the growing button. The default is a translated text ("More") coming from the message bundle. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

properties.name: growingScrollToLoad
properties.description: If set to true, the user can scroll down/up to load more items. Otherwise a growing button is displayed at the bottom/top of the control. Note: This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true and only if there is one instance of sap.m.List or sap.m.Table inside the scrollable scroll container (e.g sap.m.Page).

properties.name: growingDirection
properties.description: Defines the direction of the growing feature. If set to Downwards the user has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom. If set to Upwards the user has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top.

properties.name: rememberSelections
properties.description: If set to true, this control remembers and retains the selection of the items after a binding update has been performed (e.g. sorting, filtering). Note: This feature works only if two-way data binding for the selected property of the item is not used. It also needs to be turned off if the binding context of the item does not always point to the same entry in the model, for example, if the order of the data in the JSONModel is changed.

properties.name: keyboardMode
properties.description: Defines keyboard handling behavior of the control.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Defines the items contained within this control.

aggregations.name: swipeContent
aggregations.description: User can swipe to bring in this control on the right hand side of an item. Note: For non-touch devices, this functionality is ignored.

aggregations.name: headerToolbar
aggregations.description: The header area can be used as a toolbar to add extra controls for user interactions. Note: When set, this overwrites the headerText property.

aggregations.name: infoToolbar
aggregations.description: A toolbar that is placed below the header to show extra information to the user.

aggregations.name: dragDropConfig
aggregations.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration.

aggregations.name: contextMenu
aggregations.description: Defines the context menu of the items.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: select
events.description: Fires when selection is changed via user interaction. In MultiSelect mode, this event is also fired on deselection.

deprecated.text: Use the selectionChange event instead.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item which fired the select event.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: Fires when selection is changed via user interaction inside the control.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item whose selection has changed. In MultiSelect mode, only the up-most selected item is returned. This parameter can be used for single-selection modes.

listItems.name: listItems
listItems.description: Array of items whose selection has changed. This parameter can be used for MultiSelect mode.

selected.name: selected
selected.description: Indicates whether the listItem parameter is selected or not.

selectAll.name: selectAll
selectAll.description: Indicates whether the select all action is triggered or not.

events.name: delete
events.description: Fires when delete icon is pressed by user.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item which fired the delete event.

events.name: swipe
events.description: Fires after user's swipe action and before the swipeContent is shown. On the swipe event handler, swipeContent can be changed according to the swiped item. Calling the preventDefault method of the event cancels the swipe action.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item which fired the swipe.

swipeContent.name: swipeContent
swipeContent.description: Aggregated swipeContent control that is shown on the right hand side of the item.

srcControl.name: srcControl
srcControl.description: Holds which control caused the swipe event within the item.

events.name: growingStarted
events.description: Fires before the new growing chunk is requested from the model.

deprecated.text: Instead, use updateStarted event with listening changeReason.

events.name: growingFinished
events.description: Fires after the new growing chunk has been fetched from the model and processed by the control.

deprecated.text: Instead, use "updateFinished" event.

events.name: updateStarted
events.description: Fires before items binding is updated (e.g. sorting, filtering) Note: Event handler should not invalidate the control.

reason.name: reason
reason.description: The reason of the update, e.g. Binding, Filter, Sort, Growing, Change, Refresh, Context.

total.name: total
total.description: The total count of bound items. This can be used if the growing property is set to true.

events.name: updateFinished
events.description: Fires after items binding is updated and processed by the control.

reason.name: reason
reason.description: The reason of the update, e.g. Binding, Filter, Sort, Growing, Change, Refresh, Context.

total.name: total
total.description: The total count of bound items. This can be used if the growing property is set to true.

events.name: itemPress
events.description: Fires when an item is pressed unless the item's type property is Inactive.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: The item which fired the pressed event.

srcControl.name: srcControl
srcControl.description: The control which caused the press event within the container.

events.name: beforeOpenContextMenu
events.description: Fired when the context menu is opened. When the context menu is opened, the binding context of the item is set to the given contextMenu.

listItem.name: listItem
listItem.description: Item in which the context menu was opened.

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:beforeOpenContextMenu beforeOpenContextMenu} event of this sap.m.ListBase. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.m.ListBase itself. Fired when the context menu is opened. methods.name: getAriaLabelledBy
methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

methods.name: getContextMenu
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContextMenu contextMenu}.

Defines the context menu of the items.

methods.name: getDragDropConfig
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDragDropConfig dragDropConfig}.

Defines the drag-and-drop configuration.

methods.name: getEnableBusyIndicator

returnValue.description: Value of property enableBusyIndicator

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableBusyIndicator enableBusyIndicator}. When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property. Default value is true.

methods.name: getFooterText

returnValue.description: Value of property footerText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFooterText footerText}.

Defines the footer text that appears in the control.

methods.name: getGrowing

returnValue.description: Value of property growing

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowing growing}. If set to true, enables the growing feature of the control to load more items by requesting from the model. Note:: This feature only works when an items aggregation is bound. Growing must not be used together with two-way binding. Default value is false.

methods.name: getGrowingDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property growingDirection

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowingDirection growingDirection}. Defines the direction of the growing feature. If set to Downwards the user has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom. If set to Upwards the user has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top. Default value is Downwards.

methods.name: getGrowingInfo
methods.description: Returns growing information as object with "actual" and "total" keys. Note: This function returns "null" if "growing" feature is disabled.

methods.name: getGrowingScrollToLoad

returnValue.description: Value of property growingScrollToLoad

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowingScrollToLoad growingScrollToLoad}. If set to true, the user can scroll down/up to load more items. Otherwise a growing button is displayed at the bottom/top of the control. Note: This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true and only if there is one instance of sap.m.List or sap.m.Table inside the scrollable scroll container (e.g sap.m.Page). Default value is false.

methods.name: getGrowingThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property growingThreshold

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold}. Defines the number of items to be requested from the model for each grow. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true. Default value is 20.

methods.name: getGrowingTriggerText

returnValue.description: Value of property growingTriggerText

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGrowingTriggerText growingTriggerText}. Defines the text displayed on the growing button. The default is a translated text ("More") coming from the message bundle. This property can only be used if the growing property is set to true.

methods.name: getHeaderDesign

Note: This feature works only if two-way data binding for the selected property of the item is not used. When this property is set to true, the control will automatically display a busy indicator when it detects that data is being loaded. This busy indicator blocks the interaction with the items until data loading is finished. By default, the busy indicator will be shown after one second. This behavior can be customized by setting the busyIndicatorDelay property. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

properties.name: Downwards
properties.description: User has to scroll down to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the bottom.

properties.name: Upwards
properties.description: User has to scroll up to load more items or the growing button is displayed at the top. Note: If this option is active, there should not be any other control than sap.m.List inside its ScollContainer.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListItemBase
symbols.description: ListItemBase contains the base features of all specific list items. Note: If not mentioned otherwise in the individual subclasses, list items must only be used in the items aggregation of sap.m.ListBase controls.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the visual indication and behavior of the list items, e.g. Active, Navigation, Detail.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder is rendered instead of the real control.

properties.name: unread
properties.description: Activates the unread indicator for the list item, if set to true. Note: This flag is ignored when the showUnread property of the parent is set to false.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Defines the selected state of the list items. Note: Binding the selected property in single selection modes may cause unwanted results if you have more than one selected items in your binding.

properties.name: counter
properties.description: Defines the counter value of the list items.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: Defines the highlight state of the list items.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListKeyboardMode
symbols.description: Defines the keyboard handling behavior of the sap.m.List or sap.m.Table.

properties.name: Edit
properties.description: This mode is suitable if the number of items is limited and if there are editable fields within the item. While the last/first interactive element within an item has the focus, pressing tab/shift+tab moves the focus to the next/previous element in the tab chain after/before the item .

properties.name: Navigation
properties.description: This default mode is suitable if the number of items is unlimited or if there is no editable field within the item. While the last/first interactive element within an item has the focus, pressing tab/shift+tab moves the focus to the next/previous element in the tab chain after/before the sap.m.List or sap.m.Table.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListMode
symbols.description: Defines the mode of the list.

properties.name: Delete
properties.description: Delete mode (only one list item can be deleted via provided delete button)

properties.name: MultiSelect
properties.description: Multi selection mode (more than one list item can be selected).

properties.name: None
properties.description: Default mode (no selection).

properties.name: SingleSelect
properties.description: Right-positioned single selection mode (only one list item can be selected).

properties.name: SingleSelectLeft
properties.description: Left-positioned single selection mode (only one list item can be selected).

properties.name: SingleSelectMaster
properties.description: Selected item is highlighted but no selection control is visible (only one list item can be selected).

symbols.name: sap.m.ListSeparators
symbols.description: Defines which separator style will be applied for the items.

properties.name: All
properties.description: Separators between the items including the last and the first one.

properties.name: Inner
properties.description: Separators between the items. Note: This enumeration depends on the theme.

properties.name: None
properties.description: No item separators.

symbols.name: sap.m.ListType
symbols.description: Defines the visual indication and behaviour of the list items.

properties.name: Active
properties.description: Indicates that the item is clickable via active feedback when item is pressed.

properties.name: Detail
properties.description: Enables detail button of the list item that fires detailPress event. Also see {@link sap.m.ListItemBase#attachDetailPress}.

properties.name: DetailAndActive
properties.description: Enables {@link sap.m.ListType.Detail} and {@link sap.m.ListType.Active} enumerations together.

properties.name: Inactive
properties.description: Indicates the list item does not have any active feedback when item is pressed. Note: Inactive type cannot be used to disable list items.

properties.name: Navigation
properties.description: Indicates the list item is navigable to show extra information about the item.

symbols.name: sap.m.LoadState
symbols.description: Enumeration of possible load statuses.

properties.name: Disabled
properties.description: The control is disabled.

properties.name: Failed
properties.description: The control failed to load.

properties.name: Loaded
properties.description: The control has loaded.

properties.name: Loading
properties.description: The control is loading.

symbols.name: sap.m.MaskInput
symbols.description: The sap.m.MaskInput control allows users to easily enter data in a certain format and in a fixed-width input (for example: date, time, phone number, credit card number, currency, IP address, MAC address, and others).

properties.name: placeholderSymbol
properties.description: Defines a placeholder symbol. Shown at the position where there is no user input yet.

properties.name: mask
properties.description: Mask defined by its characters type (respectively, by its length). You should consider the following important facts: 1. The mask characters normally correspond to an existing rule (one rule per unique char). Characters which don't, are considered immutable characters (for example, the mask '2099', where '9' corresponds to a rule for digits, has the characters '2' and '0' as immutable). 2. Adding a rule corresponding to the placeholderSymbol is not recommended and would lead to an unpredictable behavior. 3. You can use the special escape character '^' called "Caret" prepending a rule character to make it immutable. Use the double escape '^^' if you want to make use of the escape character as an immutable one.

aggregations.name: rules
aggregations.description: A list of validation rules (one rule per mask character).

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.m.MenuButton
symbols.description: The sap.m.MenuButton control enables the user to show a hierarchical menu.

properties.name: text
properties.description:
Defines the text of the MenuButton.
Note: In Split buttonMode with useDefaultActionOnly set to false, the text is changed to display the last selected item's text, while in Regular buttonMode the text stays unchanged.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Defines the type of the MenuButton (for example, Default, Accept, Reject, Back, etc.)

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Defines the width of the MenuButton.
Note:As per visual design this width can be maximum of 12rem (192px).

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
Boolean property to enable the control (default is true).
Note: Depending on custom settings, the buttons that are disabled have other colors than the enabled ones.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Defines the icon to be displayed as a graphical element within the button. It can be an image or an icon from the icon font.

properties.name: activeIcon
properties.description: The source property of an alternative icon for the active (pressed) state of the button. Both active and default icon properties should be defined and of the same type - image or icon font. If the icon property is not set or has a different type, the active icon is not displayed.

properties.name: iconDensityAware
properties.description: When set to true (default), one or more requests are sent trying to get the density perfect version of image if this version of image doesn't exist on the server. If only one version of image is provided, set this value to false to avoid the attempt of fetching density perfect image.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: buttonMode
properties.description: Defines whether the MenuButton is set to Regular or Split mode.

properties.name: useDefaultActionOnly
properties.description: Controls whether the default action handler is invoked always or it is invoked only until a menu item is selected. Usable only if buttonMode is set to Split.

aggregations.name: menu
aggregations.description: Defines the menu that opens for this button.

aggregations.name: _button
aggregations.description: Internal aggregation that contains the button part.

events.name: defaultAction
events.description: Fired when the buttonMode is set to Split and the user presses the main button unless useDefaultActionOnly is set to false and another action from the menu has been selected previously.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.m.MenuButtonMode
symbols.description: Different modes for a MenuButton (predefined types).

properties.name: Regular
properties.description: Default regular type (Menu button appears as a regular button, pressing opens a menu)

properties.name: Split
properties.description: Split type (Menu button appears as a split button, pressing fires the default action a menu, pressing the arrow part opens a menu)

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox

methods.name: alert

returnValue.description: The created MessageBox

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMessage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: callback function to be called when the user closes the dialog

title.name: title
title.description: Title to be displayed in the alert dialog

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the alert dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the alert dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus
initialFocus.description: Added since version 1.28.0. initialFocus, this option sets the action name, the text of the button or the control that gets the focus as first focusable element after the MessageBox is opened. The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

textDirection.name: textDirection
textDirection.description: Added since version 1.28. Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

verticalScrolling.name: verticalScrolling
verticalScrolling.description: verticalScrolling is deprecated since version 1.30.4. VerticalScrolling, this option indicates if the user can scroll vertically inside the MessageBox when the content is larger than the content area.

horizontalScrolling.name: horizontalScrolling
horizontalScrolling.description: horizontalScrolling is deprecated since version 1.30.4. HorizontalScrolling, this option indicates if the user can scroll horizontally inside the MessageBox when the content is larger than the content area.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Displays an alert dialog with the given message and an OK button (no icons). 
sap.m.MessageBox.alert("This message should appear in the alert", {
    title: "Alert",                                      // default
    onClose: null,                                       // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
});
If a callback is given, it is called after the alert dialog has been closed by the user via the OK button. The callback is called with the following signature: 
  function (oAction)
where oAction can be either sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK when the alert dialog is closed by tapping on the OK button or null when the alert dialog is closed by calling sap.m.InstanceManager.closeAllDialogs(). The alert dialog opened by this method is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the alert dialog.

methods.name: confirm

returnValue.description: The created MessageBox

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMessage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Callback to be called when the user closes the dialog

title.name: title
title.description: Title to display in the confirmation dialog

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the confirmation dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the confirmation dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus

The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Displays a confirmation dialog with the given message, a QUESTION icon, an OK button and a Cancel button. If a callback is given, it is called after the confirmation box has been closed by the user with one of the buttons. 
sap.m.MessageBox.confirm("This message should appear in the confirmation", {
    title: "Confirm",                                    // default
    onClose: null                                        // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
    });
The callback is called with the following signature 
  function(oAction)
where oAction is set by one of the following three values: 1. sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK: OK (confirmed) button is tapped. 2. sap.m.MessageBox.Action.Cancel: Cancel (unconfirmed) button is tapped. 3. null: Confirm dialog is closed by calling sap.m.InstanceManager.closeAllDialogs() The confirmation dialog opened by this method is processed asynchronously. Applications have to use fnCallback to continue work after the user closed the confirmation dialog

parameters.name: vMessage
parameters.description: Message to be displayed in the alert dialog. The usage of sap.core.Control as vMessage is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

parameters.name: mOptions

title.name: title
title.description: The title of the message box.

actions.name: actions
actions.description: Either a single action, or an array of two actions. If no action(s) are given, the single action MessageBox.Action.OK is taken as a default for the parameter. From UI5 version 1.21, more than 2 actions are supported. For the former versions, if more than two actions are given, only the first two actions are taken. Custom action string(s) can be provided, and then the translation of custom action string(s) needs to be done by the application.

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Function to be called when the user taps a button or closes the message box.

id.name: id
id.description: ID to be used for the dialog. Intended for test scenarios, not recommended for productive apps

styleClass.name: styleClass
styleClass.description: Added since version 1.21.2. CSS style class which is added to the dialog's root DOM node. The compact design can be activated by setting this to "sapUiSizeCompact"

initialFocus.name: initialFocus
initialFocus.description: Added since version 1.28.0. initialFocus, this option sets the action name, the text of the button or the control that gets the focus as first focusable element after the MessageBox is opened. The usage of sap.ui.core.Control to set initialFocus is deprecated since version 1.30.4.

textDirection.name: textDirection
textDirection.description: Added since version 1.28. Specifies the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

verticalScrolling.name: verticalScrolling
verticalScrolling.description: verticalScrolling is deprecated since version 1.30.4. VerticalScrolling, this option indicates if the user can scroll vertically inside the MessageBox when the content is larger than the content area.

horizontalScrolling.name: horizontalScrolling
horizontalScrolling.description: horizontalScrolling is deprecated since version 1.30.4. HorizontalScrolling, this option indicates if the user can scroll horizontally inside the MessageBox when the content is larger than the content area.

details.name: details
details.description: Added since version 1.28.0. If 'details' is set in the MessageBox, a 'Show detail' link is added. When you click the link, it is set to visible = false and the text area containing 'details' information is then displayed.

parameters.description: Other options (optional)

methods.description:
Creates and displays an sap.m.Dialog with type sap.m.DialogType.Message with the given text and buttons, and optionally other parts. After the user has tapped a button, the onClose function is invoked when given. The only mandatory parameter is vMessage. Either a string with the corresponding text or even a layout control could be provided. 
sap.m.MessageBox.show("This message should appear in the message box", {
    icon: sap.m.MessageBox.Icon.NONE,                    // default
    title: "",                                           // default
    actions: sap.m.MessageBox.Action.OK                  // default
    onClose: null                                        // default
    styleClass: ""                                       // default
    initialFocus: null                                   // default
    textDirection: sap.ui.core.TextDirection.Inherit     // default
});
The created dialog is executed asynchronously. When it has been created and registered for rendering, this function returns without waiting for a user reaction. When applications have to react on the users choice, they have to provide a callback function and postpone any reaction on the user choice until that callback is triggered. The signature of the callback is function (oAction); where oAction is the button that the user has tapped. For example, when the user has pressed the close button, an sap.m.MessageBox.Action.Close is returned.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox.Action
symbols.description:
Enumeration of supported actions in a MessageBox.

Each action is represented as a button in the message box. The values of this enumeration are used for both, specifying the set of allowed actions as well as reporting back the user choice.

properties.name: ABORT
properties.description: Adds an "Abort" button to the message box.

properties.name: CANCEL
properties.description: Adds a "Cancel" button to the message box.

properties.name: CLOSE
properties.description: Adds a "Close" button to the message box.

properties.name: DELETE
properties.description: Adds a "Delete" button to the message box.

properties.name: IGNORE
properties.description: Adds an "Ignore" button to the message box.

properties.name: NO
properties.description: Adds a "No" button to the message box.

properties.name: OK
properties.description: Adds an "OK" button to the message box.

properties.name: RETRY
properties.description: Adds a "Retry" button to the message box.

properties.name: YES
properties.description: Adds a "Yes" button to the message box.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageBox.Icon
symbols.description: Enumeration of the pre-defined icons that can be used in a MessageBox.

properties.name: ERROR
properties.description: Shows the error icon in the message box.

properties.name: INFORMATION
properties.description: Shows the information icon in the message box.

properties.name: NONE
properties.description: Shows no icon in the message box.

properties.name: QUESTION
properties.description: Shows the question icon in the message box.

properties.name: SUCCESS
properties.description: Shows the success icon in the message box.

properties.name: WARNING
properties.description: Shows the warning icon in the message box.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageItem
symbols.description:
A wrapper control used to hold different types of system messages.

Structure

The message item holds the basic set of properties for a system message:
  • Type, title, subtitle and description
  • If the description contains markup, the markupDescription needs to be set to true, to ensure it is interpreted correctly.
  • If the long text description can be specified by a URL by setting, the longtextUrl property.
  • The message item can have a single {@link sap.m.Link} after the description. It is stored in the link aggregation.

    • Usage

    Note: The MessageItem control replaces {@link sap.m.MessagePopoverItem} as a more generic wrapper for messages.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specifies the type of the message

properties.name: title
properties.description: Specifies the title of the message

properties.name: subtitle
properties.description: Specifies the subtitle of the message Note: This is only visible when the title property is not empty.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Specifies detailed description of the message

properties.name: markupDescription
properties.description: Specifies if description should be interpreted as markup

properties.name: longtextUrl
properties.description: Specifies long text description location URL

properties.name: counter
properties.description: Defines the number of messages for a given message.

properties.name: groupName
properties.description: Name of a message group the current item belongs to.

aggregations.name: link
aggregations.description: Adds an sap.m.Link control which will be displayed at the end of the description of a message.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessagePage
symbols.description:
Displays an empty page with an icon and a header when certain conditions are met.

Overview

MessagePage is displayed when there is no data or matching content. There are different use cases where a MessagePage might be visualized, for example:
  • The search query returned no results
  • The app contains no items
  • There are too many items
  • The application is loading
The layout is unchanged but the text and icon vary depending on the use case.

Usage

Note: The MessagePage is not intended to be used as a top-level control, but rather used within controls such as NavContainer, App, Shell or other container controls.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Determines the main text displayed on the MessagePage.

properties.name: description
properties.description: Determines the detailed description that shows additional information on the MessagePage.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Determines the title in the header of MessagePage.

properties.name: showHeader
properties.description: Determines the visibility of the MessagePage header. Can be used to hide the header of the MessagePage when it's embedded in another page.

properties.name: showNavButton
properties.description: Determines the visibility of the navigation button in MessagePage header.

properties.name: icon
properties.description: Determines the icon displayed on the MessagePage.

properties.name: iconAlt
properties.description: Defines the alt attribute of the icon displayed on the MessagePage.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Determines the element's text directionality with enumerated options. By default, the control inherits text direction from the DOM.

properties.name: enableFormattedText
properties.description: Defines whether the value set in the description property is displayed as formatted text in HTML format. For details regarding supported HTML tags, see {@link sap.m.FormattedText}

aggregations.name: customText
aggregations.description: The (optional) custom Text control of this page. Use this aggregation when the "text" (sap.m.Text) control needs to be replaced with an sap.m.Link control. "text" and "textDirection" setters can be used for this aggregation.

aggregations.name: customDescription
aggregations.description: The (optional) custom description control of this page. Use this aggregation when the "description" (sap.m.Text) control needs to be replaced with an sap.m.Link control. "description" and "textDirection" setters can be used for this aggregation.

aggregations.name: buttons
aggregations.description: The buttons displayed under the description text. Note: Buttons added to this aggregation are both vertically and horizontally centered. Depending on the available space, they may be rendered on several lines.

aggregations.name: _internalHeader
aggregations.description: A header bar which is managed internally by the MessagePage control.

aggregations.name: _formattedText
aggregations.description: The formatted text which is used when enableFormattedText is true.

aggregations.name: _text
aggregations.description: The text displayed under the icon.

aggregations.name: _description
aggregations.description: The description displayed under the text when enableFormattedText is false.

associations.name: ariaDescribedBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / ids which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: navButtonPress
events.description: This event is fired when Nav Button is pressed.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessagePopover
symbols.description:
A summarized list of different types of messages.

Overview

A message popover is used to display a summarized list of different types of messages (errors, warnings, success and information). It provides a handy and systemized way to navigate and explore details for every message.

Notes:

  • Messages can have descriptions pre-formatted with HTML markup. In this case, the markupDescription has to be set to true.
  • If the message cannot be fully displayed or includes a long description, the message popover provides navigation to the detailed description.

Structure

The message popover stores all messages in an association of type {@link sap.m.MessageItem} named items. A set of properties determines how the items are rendered:
  • counter - An integer that is used to indicate the number of errors for each type
  • type - The type of message
  • title/subtitle - The title and subtitle of the message
  • description - The long text description of the message

Usage

With the message concept, MessagePopover provides a way to centrally manage messages and show them to the user without additional work for the developer. The message popover is triggered from a messaging button in the footer toolbar. If an error has occurred at any validation point, the total number of messages should be incremented, but the user's work shouldn't be interrupted.

Responsive Behavior

On mobile phones, the message popover is automatically shown in full screen mode.
On desktop and tablet, the message popover opens in a popover.
On desktop the opened popover is resizable if it is placed in a {@link sap.m.Toolbar}, {@link sap.m.Bar} or used in {@link sap.f.semantic.SemanticPage}

properties.name: asyncDescriptionHandler
properties.description: Callback function for resolving a promise after description has been asynchronously loaded inside this function

properties.name: asyncURLHandler
properties.description: Callback function for resolving a promise after a link has been asynchronously validated inside this function

properties.name: placement
properties.description: Determines the position, where the control will appear on the screen. Possible values are: sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Top, sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Bottom and sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Vertical. The default value is sap.m.VerticalPlacementType.Vertical. Setting this property while the control is open, will not cause any re-rendering and changing of the position. Changes will only be applied with the next interaction.

properties.name: initiallyExpanded
properties.description: Sets the initial state of the control - expanded or collapsed. By default the control opens as expanded.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageStrip
symbols.description:
MessageStrip is a control that enables the embedding of application-related messages in the application.

Overview

The message strip displays 4 types of messages, each with a corresponding semantic color and icon: Information, Success, Warning and Error. Each message can have a close button, so that it can be removed from the UI if needed. With version 1.50 you can use a limited set of formatting tags for the message text by setting enableFormattedText. The allowed tags are:
  • <a>
  • <em>
  • <strong>
  • <u>

Usage

When to use

  • You want to provide information or status update within the detail area of an object

When not to use

  • You want to display information within the object page header, within a control, in the master list, or above the page header.

properties.name: text
properties.description: Determines the text of the message.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Determines the type of messages that are displayed in the MessageStrip. Possible values are: Information (default), Success, Warning, Error. If None is passed, the value is set to Information and a warning is displayed in the console.

properties.name: customIcon
properties.description: Determines a custom icon which is displayed. If none is set, the default icon for this message type is used.

properties.name: showIcon
properties.description: Determines if an icon is displayed for the message.

properties.name: showCloseButton
properties.description: Determines if the message has a close button in the upper right corner.

properties.name: enableFormattedText
properties.description:
Determines the limited collection of HTML elements passed to the text property should be evaluated. Note: If this property is set to true the string passed to text property can evaluate the following list of limited HTML elements. All other HTML elements and their nested content will not be rendered by the control:
  • a
  • em
  • strong
  • u

aggregations.description: Adds an sap.m.Link control which will be displayed at the end of the message.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageToast
symbols.description:
A small, non-disruptive popup for messages.

Overview

A message toast is a small, non-disruptive popup for success or information messages that disappears automatically after a few seconds. Toasts automatically disappear after a timeout unless the user moves the mouse over the toast or taps on it.

Notes:

  • If the configured message contains HTML code or script tags, those will be escaped.
  • Line breaks (\r\n, \n\r, \r, \n) will be visualized.
  • Only one message toast can be shown at a time in the same place.

Example:

Here is an example of a MessageToast with all default options: 
sap.m.MessageToast.show("This message should appear in the message toast", {
    duration: 3000,                  // default
    width: "15em",                   // default
    my: "center bottom",             // default
    at: "center bottom",             // default
    of: window,                      // default
    offset: "0 0",                   // default
    collision: "fit fit",            // default
    onClose: null,                   // default
    autoClose: true,                 // default
    animationTimingFunction: "ease", // default
    animationDuration: 1000,         // default
    closeOnBrowserNavigation: true   // default
});

Usage

When to use:

  • You want to display a short success of information message.
  • You do not want to interrupt users while they are performing an action.
  • You want to confirm a successful action.

When not to use:

  • You want to display an error or warning message.
  • You want to interrupt users while they are performing an action.
  • You want to make sure that users read the message before they leave the page.
  • You want users to be able to copy some part of the message text. (In this case, show a success {@link sap.m.Dialog Message Dialog}.)

Responsive Behavior

The message toast has the same behavior on all devices. However, you can adjust the width of the control, for example, for use on a desktop device.

methods.name: show

parameters.name: sMessage
parameters.description: The message to be displayed.

parameters.name: mOptions

duration.name: duration
duration.description: Time in milliseconds before the close animation starts. Needs to be a finite positive nonzero integer.

width.name: width
width.description: The width of the message toast, this value can be provided in %, em, px and all possible CSS measures.

my.name: my
my.description: Specifies which point of the message toast should be aligned.

at.name: at
at.description: Specifies the point of the reference element to which the message toast should be aligned.

of.name: of
of.description: Specifies the reference element to which the message toast should be aligned, by default it is aligned to the browser visual viewport.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The offset relative to the docking point, specified as a string with space-separated pixel values (e.g. "0 10" to move the message toast 10 pixels to the right).

collision.name: collision
collision.description: Specifies how the position of the message toast should be adjusted in case it overflows the screen in some direction. Possible values “fit”, “flip”, “none”, or a pair for horizontal and vertical e.g. "fit flip”, "fit none".

onClose.name: onClose
onClose.description: Function to be called when the message toast closes.

autoClose.name: autoClose
autoClose.description: Specify whether the message toast should close as soon as the end user touches the screen.

animationTimingFunction.name: animationTimingFunction
animationTimingFunction.description: Describes how the close animation will progress. Possible values "ease", "linear", "ease-in", "ease-out", "ease-in-out". This feature is not supported in android and ie9 browsers.

animationDuration.name: animationDuration
animationDuration.description: Time in milliseconds that the close animation takes to complete. Needs to be a finite positive integer. For not animation set to 0. This feature is not supported in android and ie9 browsers.

closeOnBrowserNavigation.name: closeOnBrowserNavigation
closeOnBrowserNavigation.description: Specifies if the message toast closes on browser navigation.

parameters.description: Object which can contain all other options. Not all entries in this object are required. This property is optional.

methods.description: Creates and displays a simple message toast notification message with the given text, and optionally other options. The only mandatory parameter is sMessage.

symbols.name: sap.m.MessageView
symbols.description:
Overview

A {@link sap.m.MessageView} is used to display a summarized list of different types of messages (errors, warnings, success and information). It provides a handy and systemized way to navigate and explore details for every message. It is meant to be embedded into container controls. If the MessageView contains only one item, which has either description, markupDescription or longTextUrl, its details page will be displayed initially.

Notes:
  • Messages can have descriptions pre-formatted with HTML markup. In this case, the markupDescription has to be set to true.
  • If the message cannot be fully displayed or includes a long description, the MessageView provides navigation to the detailed description.
Structure

The MessageView stores all messages in an association of type {@link sap.m.MessageItem} named items.
A set of properties determines how the items are rendered:
  • counter - An integer that is used to indicate the number of errors for each type
  • type - The type of message
  • title/subtitle - The title and subtitle of the message
  • description - The long text description of the message
Usage

As part of the messaging concept, MessageView provides a way to centrally manage messages and show them to the user without additional work for the developer.

symbols.name: sap.m.MultiComboBox
symbols.description: The MultiComboBox control provides a list box with items and a text field allowing the user to either type a value directly into the control or choose from the list of existing items.

properties.name: selectedKeys
properties.description: Keys of the selected items. If the key has no corresponding item, no changes will apply. If duplicate keys exists the first item matching the key is used.

associations.description: Provides getter and setter for the selected items from the aggregation named items.

symbols.name: sap.m.MultiEditField
symbols.description: This control allows you to add items to a sap.m.Select instance. In addition, based on the property set, a set of pre-filled entries is added.

properties.name: selectedItem
properties.description: The selected item from items aggregation. This can be null if no valid item or special item is selected.

properties.name: showValueHelp
properties.description: Defines whether the 'Select new value' item should be available in the selection field. Please note that upon selecting this item, the previously selected item is restored. As a consequence, the selectedItem property never contains this item.

properties.name: nullable
properties.description: Defines whether the 'Leave blank' item should be available in the selection field.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Defines whether the 'Label' is required for the selection field.

symbols.name: sap.m.MultiInput
symbols.description:
Overview

A multi-input field allows the user to enter multiple values, which are displayed as {@link sap.m.Token tokens}. These can be displayed in single and multi-line mode. You can enable auto-complete suggestions or value help to help the user choose the correct entry. You can define validator functions to define what token values are accepted. Notes:
  • New valid tokens are created, when the user presses Enter, selects a value from the suggestions drop-down, or when the focus leaves the field.
  • Provide meaningful labels for all input fields. Do not use the placeholder as a replacement for the label.

Usage

When to use:

  • You need to provide the value help option to help users select or search multiple business objects.
  • The dataset to choose from is expected to increase over time (for example, to more than 200 values).

When not to use:

  • Do not use multi-line inputs in tables and forms.
  • When you need to select only one value.
  • When you want the user to select from a predefined set of options. Use {@link sap.m.MultiComboBox} instead.

Responsive Behavior

On Phones:
  • Only the last entered token is displayed.
  • A new full-screen dialog opens where the auto-complete suggestions can be selected.
  • You can review the tokens by tapping on the token or the input field.
On Tablets:
  • The auto-complete suggestions appear below or above the multi-input field.
  • You can review the tokens by swiping them to the left or right.
  • (Multi-line Mode) Previously added tokens are visible above the input field.
On Desktop:
  • The auto-complete suggestions appear below or above the multi-input field.
  • You can review the tokens by pressing the right or left arrows on the keyboard.
  • You can select single tokens or a range of tokens and you can copy/cut/delete them. (Multi-line Mode) Previously added tokens are visible above the input field.

properties.name: enableMultiLineMode
properties.description: If set to true, the MultiInput will be displayed in multi-line display mode. In multi-line display mode, all tokens can be fully viewed and easily edited in the MultiInput. The default value is false. Note: This property does not take effect on smartphones or when the editable property is set to false. Caution: Do not enable multi-line mode in tables and forms.

symbols.name: sap.m.NavContainer
symbols.description:
The NavContainer control handles hierarchic navigation between Pages or other fullscreen controls.

All children of this control will receive navigation events like {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild#beforeShow beforeShow}, they are documented in the pseudo interface {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild sap.m.NavContainerChild}

properties.name: autoFocus
properties.description:
Determines whether the initial focus is set automatically on first rendering and after navigating to a new page. This is useful when on touch devices the keyboard pops out due to the focus being automatically set on an input field. If necessary the "afterShow" event can be used to focus another element. Note: The following scenarios are possible, depending on where the focus was before navigation to a new page:
  • If autoFocus is set to true and the focus was inside the current page, the focus will be moved automatically on the new page.
  • If autoFocus is set to false and the focus was inside the current page, the focus will disappear.
  • If the focus was outside the current page, after the navigation it will remain unchanged regardless of what is set to the autoFocus property.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the NavContainer. Can be changed when the NavContainer should not cover the whole available area.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The width of the NavContainer. Can be changed when the NavContainer should not cover the whole available area.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the NavContainer is visible.

properties.name: defaultTransitionName
properties.description: The type of the transition/animation to apply when "to()" is called without defining a transition type to use. The default is "slide". Other options are: "fade", "flip" and "show" - and the names of any registered custom transitions.

aggregations.name: pages
aggregations.description:
The content entities between which this NavContainer navigates. These can be of type sap.m.Page, sap.ui.core.View, sap.m.Carousel or any other control with fullscreen/page semantics.

These aggregated controls will receive navigation events like {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild#beforeShow beforeShow}, they are documented in the pseudo interface {@link sap.m.NavContainerChild sap.m.NavContainerChild}

associations.name: initialPage
associations.description:
This association can be used to define which page is displayed initially. If the given page does not exist or no page is given, the first page which has been added is considered as initial page. This value should be set initially and not set/modified while the application is running.

This could be used not only for the initial display, but also if the user wants to navigate "up to top", so this page serves as a sort of "home/root page".

events.name: navigate
events.description: The event is fired when navigation between two pages has been triggered. The transition (if any) to the new page has not started yet. This event can be aborted by the application with preventDefault(), which means that there will be no navigation.

from.name: from
from.description: The page which was shown before the current navigation.

fromId.name: fromId
fromId.description: The ID of the page which was shown before the current navigation.

to.name: to
to.description: The page which will be shown after the current navigation.

toId.name: toId
toId.description: The ID of the page which will be shown after the current navigation.

firstTime.name: firstTime
firstTime.description: Whether the "to" page (more precisely: a control with the ID of the page which is currently navigated to) has not been shown/navigated to before.

isTo.name: isTo
isTo.description: Whether this is a forward navigation, triggered by "to()".

isBack.name: isBack
isBack.description: Whether this is a back navigation, triggered by "back()".

isBackToTop.name: isBackToTop
isBackToTop.description: Whether this is a navigation to the root page, triggered by "backToTop()".

isBackToPage.name: isBackToPage
isBackToPage.description: Whether this was a navigation to a specific page, triggered by "backToPage()".

direction.name: direction
direction.description: How the navigation was triggered, possible values are "to", "back", "backToPage", and "backToTop".

events.name: afterNavigate
events.description: The event is fired when navigation between two pages has completed. In case of animated transitions this event is fired with some delay after the "navigate" event.
